title: Watch footage from a drone flown down the face of the Madakaripura Waterfall in Indonesia
text:
Advertisement

There are few waterfalls as mystical and dramatic as the Madakaripura Waterfall in Indonesia.

And this incredible drone footage captures it from an angle impossible for a person – 90 degrees down its face.

It was shot by Spanish filmmaker Andres Aguilera Morillas, 23, who visited the 200-metre (656ft) waterfall in July this year.

Incredible footage captures the Madakaripura Waterfall in Indonesia from an angle impossible for a person – 90 degrees down its face

It was shot by Spanish filmmaker Andres Aguilera Morillas, 23, who visited the 200-metre (656ft) waterfall in July this year

The drone plummets down in front of the cascading water before veering through a canyon

The drone plummets down in front of the cascading water before veering sharply right and flying through a narrow foliage-filled canyon.

It then doubles back and flies up the face of the waterfall – before plunging into the canyon once again.

Andres said: ‘This location is one of the most spectacular things I have experienced in my life.

The jungle waterfall, which has been dubbed ‘the eternal waterfall ’, lies at the end of a deep valley in the foothills of the Tengger mountain range

‘Truly beautiful and magical scenery.’

The jungle waterfall, which has been dubbed ‘the eternal waterfall’, lies at the end of a deep valley in the foothills of the Tengger mountain range, about a three-hour drive from the capital of East Java, Surabaya, and not far from Mount Bromo.

To reach the waterfall, visitors must negotiate a few rocky paths.

Some tour packages include the waterfall on their itineraries.
